reviews.review_title: The one with yet another attempt at the legendary pairing...
reviews.content: Will Ferrell has always been a comedian who gets me laughing, and I remember when I saw the trailer for Holmes and Watson I thought it looked like another chance for a jolly good laugh.Also starring John C. Reilly, this is a humorous take on Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's classic mysteries featuring Sherlock Holmes and Doctor Watson. In this film they have four days to solve a case or else the Queen will become the next victim.This has some laugh out loud moments, some scenes that will make you snort, and regular lulls in the story.If you go into this expecting laughs like Blades of Glory, Anchorman, or Step Brothers then you will come away disappointed. But if you set your expectations right and go in looking for low brow humour and jokes strung together by a very basic storyline, you might just have yourself a good time.

The 42 million apparently it took to make this movie could of gone towards world hunger or fighting cancer, even paying something towards the national debt, this would of been more of a worthy cause than making this movie...

Everyone knows this was destroyed by critics for some very silly reasons. There were reports of walk out. But I like to make up my own mind and I don't mind sitting through a bad movie if it's so bad it's laughable.
The first complaint about this movie was it's simply not funny. That's simply not true. It has a silly tone to it much like any Ferrell movies. It simply has a lower budget but if you like that kind of humour you will probably like this. It's not simply a funny movie it's a pastiche of Sherlock movies. And it works. It takes aim at the Downey Jr vehicle and when it does these scenes are hilarious.
Despite it not being a big budget movie the cast has UK comedy royalty. It was also great to hear a genuine Scottish accent by Kelly MacDonald of trainspotting fame. This movie will probably play better in the UK than the US due to the acting talent involved.
There were some complaints this was anti-Trump. It's clearly not. There is one part where they joke about the electoral system but of course this applies to any elected president. The jokes are neither pro or con any political side, so to suggest this as a reason it's a bad movie is completely false.
If you enjoyed other Ferrel movies give it a go, it's not big budget by any means but as a parody of Sherlock Holmes movies it works very well. It's elementary that some of the hate is from Sherlock fans who do not like their hero ridiculed. Decent despite the negative hype.

reviews.review_title: Is it possible to give negative rating
reviews.content:
If so, I would have given minus ten.
What a silly and pathetically made film.
Boring, Bring and unoriginal...

Don't waste your money on this dumb movie! I use to like these actors but they have lost their humor and decided to push their politics on everyone. Guess they will join my growing boycott list along with many more Americans. They may figure it out when no one wants to watch their movies anymore and their big paychecks go to nothing.
Dont see this movie not even when it free on cable!! Real let down!

This is the third movie I've seen with Farrell as the lead and as usual Farrell overacting was nauseating and the subtle political overtones, I go to the theater to be entertained not soon feed politics.
As for the rest of the cast they were wasted on a weak script and a poor choice of lead in Farrell.
As I said this is the third and last film with Farrell in it at all that I'll waste money on. "Talladega Nights" beside not being funny just sucked. "Bewitched" he took a cute idea and his overacting ruined, I felt sorry for Nicole Kidman. And "Holmes & Watson" his usual overacting, or should I say trying to steal the spotlight makes you as with Kidman feel sorry for the good actors wasted on this trash.

reviews.review_title: Genuinely one of the worst films I have endured
reviews.content: Ignoring the inaccuracies throughout and just looking for a laugh, this is a dismal film. It is so bad it's actually annoying and a waste of money.

Will Ferrell's worst movie. Stranger than fiction and Elf performance of Will Ferrell were great.Comedy is not a simple or superficial form of expression.Nowadays, people need quality comedy and productions.
So disappointing and unfunny. I literally didn't laugh at all. Great cast wasted.

reviews.review_title: Just another terrible Will Ferrell movie, as per usual.
reviews.content: Will Ferrell is the least funny comedian of our age or indeed of any age. John C. Reilly is overrated as can be and sucked in 'Gangs of New York'. If you think Will Ferrell is funny you have zero sense of humor and most likely need a CT Scan.

reviews.review_title: Even not funny when you're drunk
reviews.content: I went to the cinema to see this movie and it was not worth the money/time. Even though i drank half a bottle of wine, 3 shots, and 1 beer, I didn't even smile at one point of the movie and I'm a person, that loves to laugh. This humour is either for little kids (it's a lot about pipi and kaka) or for those people, who drink way too much, that they blackout and don't mind the movie. But this movie made me think about my life and now I want to experience some more of (real)life instead of wasting my young years with cra(p) like this. Thank you.

reviews.review_title: It's not bad, but not amazing either!
reviews.content: Seems to be quite a lot of negative nelsons on here. Pfft, I mean either you hate films like this or take life too seriously, as watching films is a hobby where you have to switch off & enjoy! The reviews here are overwhelmingly negative & make the film sound a lot worse than it actually is!My review on the film is honest, so here goes:I thought the film was alright, not amazing, but alright for what it was. It wasn't boring for starters. A 1 hour & 25 minutes, this film had a decent enough story-line a decent amount of laughs (which were quite funny) & a decent amount of action in which it parody's Sherlock Holmes.I did however feel the laughs were few & far between, with some parts not being funny at all. The story wasn't anything special but what do you expect from a film like this anyway? It's a comedy. It's meant to be a parody so why go in expecting a masterpiece? The film wasn't & isn't as bad as everyone & these paid reviewers are saying. The film is pretty good, but not amazing.This film I think is a great way to end 2018 & I don't think it should be considered the worst film of this year. It's not THAT bad!So I give this film a fair rating of 5/10. It deserves a watch at least once! So go in with an open mind & don't read reviews before going! It's better to have your own interpretation of the film & not someone else's!

Absolutely amazed that this even made it onto screens, it's the most god awful load of tosh I've ever seen in my life. 10 minutes in we switched it off. The 10/10 ratings are quite obviously fake. One tart even states they had only watched for 20 mins before needing to leave a great review, not exactly riveting then was it!! Avoid at all costs is my advice

The best that can be said about this film is that it doesn't set out to be anything other than slapstick. It doesn't quite have the subtle snap of Step Brothers or Talladega Nights. The humour is overt and predictable but for something to switch off and just enjoy the fun it's not bad.

reviews.review_title: An excellent cast but so disappointing
reviews.content: The premise of this film is actually much funnier than what is delivered. With the cast attached I thought it would be worth I watch. I now deduce I was terribly wrong. It's just awful I can't understand how it went so horribly wrong with all involved, but it's a genuine mess

reviews.review_title: This is the worst movie I've seen since Year One.
reviews.content: The horror. I walked into this knowing it was at a 6 on Rotten Tomatoes, but used my AMC pass to go to a late screening anyway when my wife and kids were in bed and I was biding time before covering a co-worker's graveyard shift. The trailer convinced me that there would be at least a few laughs, and maybe the critics were dogpiling unfairly. But ye Gods, this movie is terrible. I did laugh 2-3 times early on, although I was still trying to be optimistic, and I'm not totally sure they were truly earned. Having Ralph Fiennes as Moriarty sounded like a stroke of genius, but he has maybe 3-4 minutes of total screen time.Anyhoo, if anyone reading this is tempted to go just out of curiosity whether it can really be that bad, it is. For me, no harm was done because I had paid for the pass, got to sit in a comfy recliner, and had no other interesting options other than trying to get a little more sleep or seeing the also-reviled Welcome to Marwen. Under no circumstances should anyone actually pay to see this.

reviews.review_title: Can We Talk About This For A Minute?
reviews.content: Man, oh man. This is a disappointment. I'd been looking forward to seeing this. Love Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly. They have always played off each other so well and it's been a while since the two were cast together. So, what went wrong with this?To start off, there have been a lot of "Goofy Detective Duo" films but I'm not sure that the screenwriters have ever watched any. If I had to choose a classic example of how to do this style of film right, I would have to go with "The Private Eyes" (1980) starring Don Knotts and Tim Conway. There has to be a balance of humor, mystery and thrill. This film has made a terrible error of trying too hard to be funny while totally neglecting the actual mystery. The mystery is the driving force of the film and without it you are left with a lot of goofy behavior that goes overboard turning comedy into awkwardness.Don't get me wrong. While I am disappointed, Farrell and Reilly still know how to play off each other and I did see that a few times. It is good to see them on the screen together and I hope that the trip up of this film will not dissuade them from trying to make another film.The takeaway is that this film is a fail. I hate to say that. I'm sure there will be plenty of folks who enjoyed it but it didn't work for me. :(
Ferell and Reilly after the step brothers reunite and the result is huge fun.

Forcing things in comedy is NEVER funny! Will ferrell has a habit of forcing things to try to get laughs. It never made me laugh! Never! The ONLY time i laughed at will ferrell was in austin powers and he fell over the cliff and was in pain, but even then he forced it and over did it!The only funny parts in this movie were WITHOUT will ferrell! Like when Watson was in morgue with the lady spoofing the Clay sculpting scene from Ghost. The vomiting part at morgue was prime example of how Will ferrell forces things. It wasn't funny and as i watched i wondered "does anybody laugh when he does this stuff?" The concept of making Sherlock holmes a comedy may work, but without will ferrell! I dont want to hate him but his style of comedy is the type i avoid. It's almost like three stooges, as they used abuse on themselves to get laughs. Stop forcing comedy. It wont work. And if you force it, make it look effortless.I feel bad for the people who went to cinema and paid for this! Lol.What do i find funny? Crude stuff like family guy, American Dad's Roger the gay alien, SILENCE OF THE LAMBS lotion scene! Lol! Seriously! "RUB THE LOTION ON IT'S SKIN!" Funniest movie line of the 1990's! Well, of 1991 or whenever that film was released. Will ferrell has never been funny to me. Im half black so maybe that's why. It seems only white liberal types think he's funny. Same white liberals who love the office which IS NOT FUNNY! The Office is not funny! Who told these stale, corny white dudes they were funny?! My toilet sees more comedy than they make!WHO FINANCED THIS TERRIBLE MOVIE?! So many QUALITY film concepts never get funded but THIS JUNK GETS MONEY?! Again, what fools gave money to this?! How does junk like this keep getting made but quality gets denied?! And the idiots running hollywood expect me to be a sucker and pay to see this?! I dont even want to watch for free! I cant watch this whole movie. I cant! 40 minutes into it and i'm DONE! If ROWAN ATKINSON were cast instead of Will ferrell, IT WOULD'VE BEEN HILARIOUS! Will ferrell doesn't understand comedy! STOP GIVING HIM MONEY! Stop encouraging this unfunny, forceful style. It's not funny! HE CAN'T EVEN DO AN UPPER CLASS BRITISH DIALECT! He's a "professional" and has money, gets paid and can't pay for dialect classes to get that dialect?! I can even do it and Im a Half black American from the South! My upper class british dialect is way better! How the heck do these fools making this movie and casting will ferrell expect me to pay money to see this junk?! My hear hurts watching this! WILL FERRELL IS NOT FUNNY!

As a huge fan of Step Brothers and Talladega Nights, I had mediocre hopes for this one. Decided to see it for our traditional Christmas movie outing. Let's just say, this movie was a bigger Christmas let down than the Christmas when I was 14 and my mom's boyfriend tried to fight my older brother. At least back then I got to ride in a cop car and go to a new home. Oh, and my brother totally won the fight. Don't waste your money.

It wanted to be "Dracula: Dead and Loving It," but wound up being an "Oblivion." This movie had the framework to be a funny, witty detective comedy but was just spit on a sidewalk right from the beginning.

When the washing up is more appealing or you start thinking about work you know it's a bad movie. A few cheap gags but just not worth the sheer boredom of the other 99% of the time. This was like waiting for a call centre to pick up. Then going oh look its Hugh Laurie oh it's Billy Zane and then back to your knitting or whatever.

Enjoyed this film today,plenty of daft laughs to be had and Will Ferrell and John C Reilly are tremendous together. It's about on a parr with semi pro,not the greatest Will Ferrell film but far from his worst,give it a go!
Literally created an account here just to say that this movie is dumb and disgusting.Do not watch. Ever.

For me, this is a such a bad movie that it actually becomes hilarious. If you know what to expect, then it's really funny! I laughed and cringed a lot, the filming and shots are surprisingly good, and I like the cast. Overall, a nice take on the otherwise stale Holmes and Watson!
Quite possibly the worse movie I have ever seen....and I am 58 years old, so that is saying a lot.

reviews.review_title: How did the script even get off the ground.
reviews.content: I seldom write reviews and perhaps I should more often when I enjoy a movie but this film was mortifyingly embarrassing and puerile. I stuck with it for the first 10 minutes in denial of what I was seeing, after a further 5 minutes we walked out. I felt like I was coming out of a seedy porn movie house, I really didn't want anyone to see me. It really is that embarrassing.
Embarrassing film ... only thing worth watching is Steve Coogan for the short time he's in it. I've no idea what Ferrell and Reilly think they're doing ... Its shockingly bad!

Wow I don't know what all the bad reviews are for - maybe they saw a different film. I watched this and it was so funny - I was on a plane and I was crying with laughter. I watched it a second time on the way back to make sure I hadn't been in some weird mood that made me find it funny and still found it hilarious. Maybe it's because I'm English and seeing those guys doing an unbelievably good job of taking off English accents and mannerisms. I just love John c reillys self deprecating manner and will ferrells overconfidence. I LOVED IT!

Don't bother to compare this movie to any of the others that these two were in....this is flat, dark and unfunny. The cast has no chemistry. The director had no vision or a weird sense of what is funny (and turns out unfunny). Step Brothers is one of my feel good laugh out loud faves....Holmes and Watson is just sad.

To me, a project is either good or bad. A Yes, I would recommend this to others or a No, don't waste your time.
My reviews are based on my experience and are only my opinion.
I hope they help you when deciding what to watch and what to avoid.
If you think...just think... you have found out the worst of all human stupidity and there can't be anything possibly more stupid for humans, watch this movie and then admin you were wrong

reviews.review_title: It wasn't as bad as people are making it out to be what did they expect?
reviews.content: This isn't supposed to be a true account of Sherlock Holmes or accurate in even the least respect. The next thing is it's a Will Ferrell and John C Reilley movie what are you people expecting this to be. I watched it without watching previews or listening to the negative garbage and I enjoyed it for what it was cause I had low expectation of it being factual in any way. I see all these people referencing other movies of Ferrell's and Step Brothers being one of them to that I say you cant compare every movie to one of the best the actors produced cause nothing will compare and it will ruin your viewing experience for the rest of their movies think about if you did that with any actor in any genre. This is like discounting the movie before you even begin watching it which means you won't enjoy it. Don't get me wrong its not the best newer comedy but it's far from the worst comedy to come out lately. Don't be a lemming make your own decisions forget reading reviews especially critics reviews as you can pretty much count on any negative criticisms foretold by the critics as probably a positive thing for the typical movie fan as those guys call the most boring dramadies and comedies hilarious. I see other people comparing it to older movies to them I say times have changed its not the 80-90's anymore get over it and all those comedians have pretty much dropped off the radar. I like the typical Ferrel nonsense so if you do too watch with low expectations and it can be funny in parts also don't over analyze it.

I honestly thought with the rating and reviews this film was getting... that is couldn't be as bad as they say!
Within the first 5 minutes I was still in denial... despite it starting off pretty terribly! As the movie worn on I was glad that I didn't go to the cinema to watch it as I would've been so disappointed by it that I would've walked out!
The only reason I watched the whole film was because my boyfriend convinced me that we need to see it through as it really "can't be that bad"Honestly, if you're going to watch this movie..: listen to the reviews 😂 I'm 99.9% sure John c Reilly and will Ferrel made it as a joke!
3.7 is pretty inaccurate. This movie had a lot of laughs.
I'm a big fan of these 2 and loved stepbrothers, but this was so bad we walked out!!

I can honestly say that this was the most disappointed I have been in a movie in a long time. I kept hoping it would get better, but it continued to disappoint til the very end. The silence in the theater was odd, I would have expected a rip roaring giggle fest, it NEVER happened. I honestly think people were a bit in shock at just how bad it was. I thought about walking out half way through it, but my family was in tow.
Save you money and wait til it comes out on Netflix, then you can turn it off 1/3rd of the way through it as it was truly painful to watch....Trust these reviews, it is HORRIBLE...

Not funny and super idiotic.
Waste of time.What more can I say?! Don't go. Safe yourselves.

reviews.review_title: just about the worst movie i ever watched.
reviews.content: I didnt manage to laugh more that once or twice.. really boring and not funny.

reviews.review_title: Had it's moments, but very few.
reviews.content: Starts with an overly long bullying scene, yet somewhat necessary to the character build, kind of. Will Ferrell is over the top, with a poor British accent. John C. Reilly is funny in the role of Watson, but still not great. Watching the RDJ 2009 and Game of Shadows in the same day prior to viewing this did not help this movies chances a bit. And I understand that this is a comedy and is not supposed to be taken seriously, but the humor doesn't make up for it. Imagine stepbrothers except less funny, mixed with the prior two films, mixed with the scary movie franchises, that's what you get with this movie. Is what it is, if your a fan of a less funny Anchorman, then enjoy. My advise, skip it, you'll have a better time at the BMV.
Was definitely not as bad as proclaimed. Not there best work either an ok movie with little potential to be remembered.

My wife and I see a movie every Christmas Day. We were very excited to see a Sherlock movie starring Will Ferrell slated to debut on December 25th and obviously decided thatbit would be our Christmas Day movie for 2018. I could not have imagined being more disappointed. Unfunny from the start. Recycled gags, confusing bits, and predictable outcomes throughout. We felt like we were robbed. After the movie, we talked about what we could do to try to get our money back. It was the worst "comedy" I've ever seen.
Couldn't watch 5 min and was already a waste. I don't even know we can consider this a comedy. Just awful
Unspeakably unfunny. People were sleeping in seats near me. Shameful money grab for the Holiday Season. Won't even be worth watching when it hits Netflix in February.

reviews.review_title: Worst Movies I've Seen Since War On Everyone
reviews.content: This is really awful, and more like a terrible slapstick comedy from the 1920's .... the advantage that those films had were that they were silent. I gave this movie 1 on the basis that there were some mildly amusing lines, and also some amusing things in the background, like signs on market stalls etc. But please don't waste your money on this as it really is not worth it.

Have you ever had that moment when you reach into the pocket of your old faithful jacket that never lets you down, to find what feels like a £20 note....only upon removal, to find the crispy pickled ear of a still born puppy.That moment is much like seeing the cast of Holmes & Watson only to quickly realise the lifeless atrocity I'm witnessing unfold.

reviews.review_title: Holy Watson! Was it really THAT bad?
reviews.content: I can't believe how much hate this movie is getting. Honestly, before I went to see it I knew what it was going to be and got was I was expecting out of a Will Ferrell comedy. Yeah, not all the jokes work and the writing could be better for sure, but I also got quite a few genuine laughs out of it in places too and think the chemistry and banter between Ferrell and Reilly's characters were great, as well as the casting and production side of things. I really liked the musical number in the movie and yeah it was stupid but I wasn't expecting like a smart comedy or anything. If you were expecting it to be one then that's not a good idea at all!I remember coming out of the cinema thinking "That wasn't nearly as terrible as everyone was making it out to be" and quite frankly, it's no way near the bottom of my 2018 movies rankings. Not saying it was amazing by any stretch of the imagination, but I don't feel it was nearly as bad as everyone was saying it was. A pretty easy watch and I got exactly what I was expecting, a dumb comedy.5/10

reviews.review_title: If I could give this a Zero I would
reviews.content: No film has pushed me to the point of leaving the movie before it was over until this one. For a movie with no intriguing plot line the film had to funny and spoiler alert- it was not in the slightest. The jokes were tasteless and even with Will Ferrel trying to breathe some life into the dumpster fire of a script, the movie flopped as a whole in my opinion. I recommend straying away from this movie.

As Ferell fan I was devastated at how bad this movie was!!!
The only reason I stayed for the duration was to see if there was one joke that was remotely funny. 90.minutes of my life that I will never get back.
Very few laughs in the theatre and not one from me!!!
Really disappointing and pretty sure my 4 year old would have found it too childish

reviews.review_title: Quite simply the worst film I have ever seen.
reviews.content:
Apparently someone called Etan Cohen is credited with writing this dross, along with Arthur Conan Doyle. The latter is innocent and all the blame for foisting this execrable load of unfunny garbage on us must be laid squarely at the feet of said Mr. Cohen. I won't say that he should be hunted down and destroyed for being responsible for this travesty, as I am morally against capital punishment.
But if I wasn't, that is what I would say.
Oh, it is bad. 'Though honestly I can only say that about the first 20 minutes, as I walked out at that mark. I am sure, however that it got no better. Times must be hard in the film industry to have a cast of essentially competent actors, Reilly, Ferrell, and Lord help us Ralph Fiennes putting their names forward to appear in this humorless black hole. Better they had gone on welfare than front up for this embarrassing cluster-wreck.
I at least now have a ready answer for when I am ever asked what is the worst film I have ever seen: "Holmes & Watson".

I saw this movie with pretty low expectations, but I found it to surpass them. It's a very silly comedy that does not take anything seriously which might have confused lesser folk. You see I am a dentist with an IQ 0f 142 and I am highly cultured, I listen to classical music AND metal, so I simply can't be wrong! ;)

We managed to sit through the whole film - while busy with other household chores. It took some endurance. There are a smattering of things that made us titter, but on balance the film is a real stinker. Jokes are stretched transparently thin, time and time and time again. The humour is stupid - which is fine, as long as it is novel and done with gusto - here it is just lame and laboured.
I was hoping this would be funny ... I was so wrong ... I would say save your money and wait till it comes out on cable but it's not even worth wasting your time to watch on cable

You think this movie is bad but you keep watching just to see the train wreck. But once the wreck starts you find it boring! And by the time Will starts into a very very long singing and dancing scene you must shut it off and do something more productive.

reviews.review_title: I am shocked with the low rating
reviews.content: Why is this has so low rating? The movie was hilarious. Especially around the middle. The ending was OK not a blast but OK. Overall it's a great comedy to watch once and have good laugh.

reviews.review_title: How often do you get to watch Will Ferrell become Nicholas Cage?
reviews.content: Ferrell's career is hopefully over. And I loved Will Ferrell. I hate that I paid to see this.

I love send-ups of previously 'serious' movies. Having said that I have only ever seen one movie with Will in it that I could stomach - Bewitched, and only because the other actors carried him and his role as a doofus in love with himself was a perfect fit.IMAO, the best Homes send-up was by two of the greatest actors ever - Sir Ben Kingsly and Michael Caine, in Without A Clue. If you want to see real parody done with panache and skill, watch it. If you wasted money on this amateurish effort you'll probably cry for your loss if you watch real actors doing proper acting.I expect this has already hit the 99 cent table at Menards or Wal-Mart. The two star rating instead of one is a small hat tip to the rest of the crew whose reputations have suffered for being on the credits.

Wow. Just... wow. This was the same jokes that have been told for the last 25 years regurgitated into a movie... with a trump joke thrown in. Is Hollywood so out of touch they cant come up with a new joke? Dont waste your time and money. I was the biggest WF fan.... until this.
Definitely not the greatest script, however Will and John's chemistry is always great. I would say save it for a really convenient time. Probably good to put on while making out.
This is so bad it's liteeally unwatchable! I walked out after 10 minutes.

reviews.review_title: A unique waste of money - almost
reviews.content:
Everyone has said it, so I will not repeat what other's have said: this is a uniquely poor film.Bad writing
Weak gags
Bad cosmetic surgery (Will Farrell)The supporting cast do their very best...and probably enjoyed the film's production, although I am told John C Reilly is B.A.C. (look it up)......but there is really one feature which is the most painful, for the UK audience - the rubbish British toff accents. Get it right, please God! You have been paid enough.

reviews.review_title: A Disgrace to the name of Sherlock Holmes and John Waston
reviews.content: This movie was an absolute bust. It made fun of the original stories written by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle. The movie itself was lacking in a story plot, humor, and just plain chemistry between the actors themselves. Save yourself the time after reading this and don't watch this movie or even give it a second thought.

reviews.review_title: When is the fun going to start ?
reviews.content: You know it's bad when you watch a movie and you actually think. Wait, when is it going to be funny ? Wondering if you miss read it as a comedy but then realising it's actually the worst movie you've ever seen. Career-killer ? I hope not... I love all the people involved but there's got to be some sort of Intervention for the people who approved this movie/made it happen after reading the script. Don't waste your time....

reviews.review_title: Not, as bad as everyone says.
reviews.content:
Wow, that's the best thing I can say about thus. I was in the cinema and most people stayed until the end.
A few even laughed. There where a few good jokes.
But most where forced, badly delivered or just went on too long.
Thus could be good for a few laughs for a cheap couple of hours, but otherwise, it not that good.
The bigger shame is that there are some really good actors on this struggling to give a good performance, but hampered with bad directing and everything being on the leads. Constantly.
Stars Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly just got all the screen time and don't bring enough to justify the time and also squeezing everybody else out.
I never write reviews but I must. Save your money, don't see this movie. There's zero redeeming qualities. Such a waste and I'm a Will Ferrell fan.

I think this move turned into one of those "I hate it because everyone else does" type of memes, same with Freddy Got Fingered. It's not THAT bad. It's no Oscar winner either. What it is, is 90 minutes of the type of childish silliness you always expect from Will Ferrell and John C Reilly. If you're a fan of old slapstick movies, you're probably going to like this too. If you're looking for a clever parody of Sherlock Holmes... well, you're not going to be impressed.

If I could give it less than 1 star, I would. Quite possibly the very worst movie I have ever seen. The same tied jokes repeated over and over again about cocaine and heroin.Didn't even notice the Trump jokes some have commented on -- probably because by that time my brain was numb from just how horribly, horribly bad this movie really, truly is.

Took the family to see this movie Christmas night as part of our family tradition. We are all Will Ferrell fans and we're eager to get some laughs. Out of our group of 15, six fell asleep. This movie missed it from the beginning and never recovered. There were even a few that walked out. Don't waste your money or time.
It's all his fault everything is.....also Robin Hood was his fault....
Just very bad movie. The first movie I've walked out from the theater.

I love Will and John and was hoping this would be good. It wasn't. I don't care about political jokes or anything as I am not easily offended, but it just wasn't funny.
This is the 3rd worst movie I have ever seen in my life and that's only because Downsizing and Eyes Wide Shut were a little worse... and those are awful movies!

reviews.review_title: It's elementary my dear reader - if you paid to see this your ribs will be sore...from crying
reviews.content: Unlike some others, I like my comedies, funny. I didn't laugh once - not once - except when I realised that I had actually paid to watch this. This movie didn't just miss the mark, it shot way past the boundries of earths funny bone slapping (somebody's if not) Uranus as it screamed past, rocketing off into the outer edges of comedy movie oblivion.Please don't let past successes from these two (and some other) Hollywood favorites fool you. This movie is not so much tongue-in-cheek as foot-in-mouth, unfunny.

reviews.review_title: More like a Sherlock Holmes parody!
reviews.content:
Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's Sherlock Holmes novels are really popular nowadays, people are reading it everywhere but when Holmes and Watson (2018) was realeased, almost everything had changed. The movie was quite like a joke, everything was funny and I didn't expect it to be like this.
There were Will Ferrell and John C. Reily in the film being Sherlock Holmes and Doctor Watson. The make-up was really terrible, Will Ferrell looked nothing like Sherlock Holmes, more like a Sherlock Holmes in a parody. I mean did they even watch Sherlock Holmes (2009) starring Robert Downey Jr. and Jude Law? They were more like those characters. Doctor Watson in this movie was just pranking around. Not a good acting.
The plot was terrible as well. Everything was jokes, even when Holmes accused Watson of being guilty was like a joke too. The song to rescue Watson was worse. The references in here were not good: Albert Einstein and Harry Houdini? Why do they have to be in this movie? This is the United Kingdom!!
Nothing was special in the scenes, but the jokes and humor were okay. Other scenes were really boring. From the start to finish, it was always terrible and a mess. For Sherlock Holmes Fans, don't watch this if you don't want to hate Sherlock Holmes because this movies would give you motivation to detest Sherlock Holmes.
I really think it impressively won Worst Picture from the Razzie Awards because of its bad plot, bad acting and boredom
It's Will Ferrell, what did people expect. The most overrated so called comedic actor ever. I could watch every one of his movies and not laugh once, if I didn't die from boredom first

Sadly, most of the comedy scenes were in the previews. There were a few inappropriate scenes that make it awkward for children to watch with parents. On a good note, of the comedy scenes we saw, they were hilarious. John C. Riley and Will Ferrel have mastered the art of comedic movies. Would recommend for mature audiences that look forward to a good occasional laugh.

I love these two guys in Talledega nights in and step brothers but this movie is so far from that it's just not even funny I literally. This movie need to be taken from our theater immediately because folks do not need to waste their money on this garbage.

I usually reserve scores under 3 for movies that actually have some sort of harmful effect on the world, or are the equivalent of being spat on by the people responsible for it.
This was not that bad.
The weird and jarring sociopolitical commentary was the most hamfisted i've ever seen, and at times having really dumb messages at that.
But thankfully the movie moved on with its quick pace.
It was shot moderately competently and ended up somewhat pretty albeit with some scenes that just completely dropped the ball.
But if you watch this with friends expecting nothing it will make you laugh a couple times, and offers an interesting plot as far as parodies go. The over-the-top-ness of the acting is a bit dumb at times, but it's fine. It's a nice perfectly workable if at times really low brow and disgusting comedy flick.So yeah, it has its moments, and it's kinda fun to watch, thus not deserving of all the hate.

reviews.review_title: Two STARS might be too high
reviews.content: Two STARS is assuming there is any redeeming value that I missed m to this film.. Please let me know if/when anyone finds any otther redeeming value.

reviews.review_title: Not perfect but not the disaster everybody is crying about.
reviews.content:
This film ain't perfect and I'm sure Will Ferrell and John C. Reilly will make better films in their careers BUT compared to some other.rubbish being dished out by Hollywood these days, this is not the worst.
Some jokes work, some fail badly. What works is purely down to the two leads. They could read out a phonebook and make it funny.
This film isn't great or really.good but it isn't the worst comedy I've seen.

reviews.review_title: Offensively unfunny, an embarrassment for all involved.
reviews.content: Despite being pre-warned just how bad this Sherlock Holmes spoof was, I was still unprepared for this travesty of a movie.It is tragic that the Conan Doyle estate decided to take legal action against Ian Mckellen's Mr Holmes and not this painfully unfunny excuse for comedy. Poorly written and filled with humourless and dated 'jokes,' the Benedict Cumberbatch and Robert Downey Jr versions of the character are infinitely more comedic than this character assassination of a beloved literary character.I was hoping that Holmes & Watson would be a film that was so bad it was at least entertaining, instead it's an offensive embarrassment for all involved (including some cameos from an incredibly talented supporting cast, all of whom are woefully underutilised).

reviews.review_title: Not only not funny, but stupid and gross
reviews.content: I couldn't even finish this abomination of a movie. It's not in the least funny! Not in the least. It characterizes Holmes and Watson as a Moron.The best part of the movie, if there is a best part, is the beginning, where Holmes and Watson are played by young actors.If you value your time, don't wast a single minute on this movie.
I literally wasted an hour and a half of my life on this movie. Just don't.

Holmes & Watson: Not a good film but it does have some saving graces. Such as Millicent who was raised by feral cats and Holmes's passion for her not to mention Watson's lust for Doctor Hart and their joint autopsy of Moriarty's cake victim. Also Holmes song and dance number with Millicent. Kelly Macdonald is great as a nymphomaniac Mrs Hudson. Mostly Misdirected and Miswritten by Etan Cohen. On Netflix. 4/10
This movie is awful. This movie is not funny at all. They seem desperate to have made such a horrible film.

reviews.review_title: Wish I could have given it 0 stars
reviews.content: Absolutely the worst thing I've ever seen. Big budget, big names but the writing and acting was atrocious. Don't even bother wasting your time - I wish I hadn't.

reviews.review_title: Not that bad but could do better
reviews.content:
Well honestly this is not a good movie to quote or remember but definitely not a horrible one. I've seen way much worse.A bit of slapstick, a bit of rudeness, a bit of blunt jokes and a few that left me with laughing in tears.This movie does lack a coherent plot but those that look for a plot go watch Schindler's List. The scripting is a bit dull and Farrel and Riley could be made far more crazy yet the premise and the ideas were overall nice.It's a movie to watch,
to laugh a bit,
and to move on with your life.Don't expect anything more.

reviews.review_title: Wow Will and John you couldnt get any lower...
reviews.content: This is just sad and pathetic. I could write a better screenplay while taking a massive painful Salmonella-induced diarrhea.

Im not sure what to write. It was as bad a movie as you could hope to see
Absolute nonsense. Maybe I'm a bit harsh but I expect better from Ferrell and O'Reilly
Would love those 2 hours back!

reviews.review_title: this film makes batman and robin look good!
reviews.content:
The jokes were childish, makes a fool out of one of Britain's greatest icons and spends more time shouting and screaming then solving the mystery.
the villain has little screen time, tries too hard to impress audiences and falls very flat on its face. this film is excruciatingly awful it makes batman and robin look like an amazing movie.
this motion picture, with all regards, is not worth watching with anyone.
had an appalling performance at the box office and nothing about it was funny in any aspect at all.in short, this film is utter trash and is an insult to sir Arthur Conan Doyle's brilliant sleuth.

reviews.review_title: Not Jumping on the Negative Bandwagon
reviews.content:
Okay so as a Will Ferrell fan I was a little disappointed. However, all those folks that talk about "walking out" and "worse movie ever", I say to you Bullcrap!
I've told people who ask me about it, that if I had to do it all over again I'd wait for the dvd or streaming. It was not a very good movie. All that said, it was not horrible. I had a couple of good belly laughs and a couple of sincere chuckles. It moved quickly and was fairly interesting. The acting itself wasn't bad. Probably the writing and direction was. Maybe it was the political leanings that fired up the opposition? Anyway, be honest in your reviews, sure I could go with "below average" or "poor" but right off hand I could mention a dozen. Some of this is the problem with a comedy, especially a relatively mild one. It either hits or misses.

I am a huge fan of this duo. I regret to admit that this is one of the if not the worst films I have ever seen. The comedy was not there. The characters were anoying. It was as if they had a week to film the whole movie which included the time to write the screenplay. Dont expect this to be another Stepbrothers funny movie. It is just plain awful.

I'm a Will Farrell fan but this was just bad. Their acting was fine but the movie simply sucked. The jokes were painfully dry and it drug on. We left the theater 35 minutes into the movie. Some people seem to have loved the film but I'm not one of them. Would I go see it again... Absolutely not. Everyone's taste in movies is different so if you like Will Farrell films give it a shot, but we left disappointed.
What did I just watch? I feel the need to include something positive, so here it goes. The only good part was when the kids responded with, "No sht, Sherlock!"

reviews.review_title: Makes every other movie ever made look good in comparison
reviews.content: I somehow missed this when it came out and did not remember hearing anyone talking about it. I saw it was running on TV recently and recorded it. Tonight, I decided to give it a go.This film begins with a young Sherlock being left off in the schoolyard by his mother about the age of 6 in 1867. He no more than enters the schoolyard when about two dozen other children descend upon him, physically roughing him up and even taking his pet turtle he brought with him (seriously, who brings a turtle to school on his first day?) and firing it off through the air bringing about a panicky scream from the terrified young boy.The next scene sees the turtle with a complete body cast beneath his shell, and Sherlock is sitting by himself in the same schoolyard. This time the kids all approach and say they are sorry and that this girl they know he likes wants to kiss him.Sherlock is so dumb he lets them put a blindfold on him as they lead him across for his kiss. He is startled moments later to learn they weren't sorry and that he has just kissed a donkey's rear end, delighting all of the others. He is so hurt that he is "un-crying" according to what someone in the schoolyard says. The narrator says he decided right then and there to have no feelings for anything or anyone, but to just devote his life to science and catching criminals.After seeing a montage of newspapers with many photos from the 1870s about this great boy detective, newspapers that are totally not like those in that time in history, we come to 1890s London where Professor Moriarty is on trial for murder where we are told that Holmes is about to appear with the evidence to convict him.But at his apartment, Holmes is prattling about with John Watson who keeps reminding him they need to get to the courthouse because time is running out on his chance to testify. Instead, Holmes takes forever picking out a new style hat to wear-sporting all sorts of stupid hats including one saying "Make England Great Again"-giving us a modern-day injection into the time of a century ago. We know the judge in the trial has told everyone that Moriarty will go free at exactly noon-just minutes away-if Holmes doesn't show up.We spend more time than was left on the courtroom clock with Holmes trying on hats, then going after a deadly mosquito that Watson released by opening a box that was delivered to the flat. Watson just couldn't leave it for later knowing they had to rush. This led to a silly Keystone Cops-like slapping sequence where the pair practically kill each other slapping and then hitting with heavy objects each other as the fly goes from one face to the other.Finally Holmes is able to kill the mosquito who rested on the side of a huge case of deadly bees he was keeping in his room. He appears to have only killed the bug, but moments later, the glass side of the bee case breaks open in a million pieces-how that happened is a mystery to me-and releases thousands of these deadly creatures into the apartment.Moriarty is always portrayed as Holmes's biggest adversary and any depiction of him having a chance to put Moriarty away for murder would surely have seen the great detective camping out in the hallway of the courtroom to make sure nothing prevented him from being there. To have him risk everything just to model a dozen different goofy hats for Watson? Just painfully stupid and out of character.Most Three Stooges movies showed the characters behaving in ways that made more sense. Here Holmes is portrayed as a moron too stupid to heed his colleague's admonition to leave now to get to the courthouse. Opening the package that was just left instead of waiting for later at a time when hustling to the courthouse was imperative was also moronic.But when he started lining up the cricket bat to clobber the mosquito on the side of the bee case, I started saying I cannot take much more of this. When the glass shattered half a minute after he barely tapped it, with his scientifically measured perfect swing getting the bug and not the glass, I said "That's it. I cannot stomach any more of this.I see nearly half of over 1,000 people on this site have given this film the lowest possible rating, convincing me that I was wise to quit while I wasn't quite nauseated. Believing that high a percent cannot be wrong, and knowing that I just sat through 10 minutes of the most idiotic script I have ever seen, I feel justified in joining the others in giving this thing a score of one.Since I am honestly reporting how much of it I watched, I think this acceptable. Never before have I reviewed on IMDB a film I didn't see all of. If, years from now, it is on and I don't remember it, I can check the website and see what I wrote tonight, allowing me to avoid another huge mistake. I think I'll go find a Basil Rathbone, Nigel Bruce Holmes movie to help me forget this incredible waste of movie film.

Can think of few worse films than this. It was a waste of time and money, so much so, we decided to leave after 1 hour to at least save some of that time - a first!The reunification of the Step Brothers duo made this film initially an attractive choice but, sadly, that wasn't to materialise. An embarrassing addition to the Sherlock Holmes name, poor attempts at humour raised few forced laughs following a most thin plot line.Don't waste your time and money, there are many better alternatives out there.

reviews.review_title: I laughed, but it shouldn't be a 12A.
reviews.content: I walked out of the movie less than an hour in due to the constant tasteless sexual jokes and hard drug references. I understand it's not a U or PG, but with that many blatant sex and drug themes I think 12A is an irresponsible rating. I enjoy watching movies with my 8 year old, many rated 12A due to theme or mild violence/action. But this was completely inappropriate. That being said, I did laugh at some bits up until we left; it should be marketed for adults only.
Four people in the theater and 2 walked out. One or two funny moments but was hard to sit through
How many stupid people on here with these rating and "real" feedback. It's a comedy..it's stupid..it's mocking and funny. Must be a bunch of Brit's in here offended about how stupid their history is.
Really don't waste your time, despite a number of great English actors, it's just unfunny drivel.

This movie has its moments in the opening minutes. I counted several laughs in the first half hour and then the pace slowly begins to decline as the story gets weaker and weaker. That there is a little-used cast is obvious; The talent of several stars is wasted and it is a great shame. Despite this, the tone is light and there are several moments where we see tributes to other films and for a cinephile that is welcome. One of the problems is Will Ferrell's make-up as it is frightening because of the extreme. It seems that the closing was rushed and the film could have been lengthened with ten more minutes (believe or not believe). Still not the worst movie of that year not much less.
It's so dumb!! Do not waste your time! You will regret every second you attempt to watch it!!
Wow. Beyond horrible. Watched the first half hour. I can't believe I lasted that long.

reviews.review_title: Oh ja, remind me again why I stopped watching Holmes & Watson
reviews.content:
Ten minutes and 31 seconds is all it took. Shutdown...And a few weeks later: Finished it, reluctantly. Well I did switch it off about halfway, and resumed watching again before bedtime.Will Ferret is out of his depth. He ain't no Jeremy Brett )
Reilly is so-so, so rather go watch Steve Brule clips on YT. They are friggen awesome! This movie is not awesome. Or, to put it in another way, if this is your favorite movie of all time, then you might be it's brightest star )Watch Without a Clue (88), The Adventure of Sherlock Holmes' Smarter Brother (75) Those are both solid 6/10Holmes & Watson is, at best, a 2/10"Mediocrity knows nothing higher than itself; but talent instantly recognizes genius."
Arthur Conan Doyle, The Valley of Fear
I found this film absolutely hilarious. The slapstick, the childishness, the random musical number... The reviews of everyday people are as unreliable as those of established critics. Loved it!

reviews.review_title: I really tried, shame they didn't
reviews.content: I don't listen to reviewers, i think it's time I did. The usual comedy genius is sadly lacking. A stellar cast of comedy giants couldn't save this turkey. Perhaps instead of writing cheap shots at Donald Trump try and write a comedy. Embarrassing

reviews.review_title: Pretty much step brothers mixed with sherlock holmes
reviews.content: Good funny fun movie..people have poor opinions today and unfortunately thier ignorance affects buisness..they infact need to learn to laugh.

Don't waste your time or your hard earned cash!! We persevered for an hour and then had to leave. An hour of my life I'll never get back! Wasted money on a family trip. Unfunny, bizarre " jokes", cringeworthy. Less than 0/10.

reviews.review_title: Not bad at all. Not great either.
reviews.content: I got quite few chuckles out of this movie. Not many laughs though. The bad reviews are undeserved in my opinion. If you have seem other comedys with these two actors then you should already know what you are about to watch. Crude humor and slapstick comedy. Give it a chance if you like that kind of comedy.

Hard to fathom the low rating this movie has received.I watched this, The Glass Onion and Bullet Train (both of which have received almost twice the approval rating) all within a few days; enjoyed them all but this was my favorite.Onion's Agatha Christie-esque, who-dunnit, structure is limiting and can be tedious. Bullet Train is too busy cramming in elements of other genres to be interesting for much else.Maybe, if you've seen the other Ferrell-Reilly movies, you found this stale and predictable too, but then if you've seen the other movies and don't like their style what were you doing watching this in the first place?Onion and Bullet kept me entertained, but Holmes and Watson was the only one to make me laugh.

reviews.review_title: The worst movie I have ever seen
reviews.content: Someone compared this movie to The Naked Gun, Wow! There is no way this film is anywhere near that movie. I generally like Will Farrell but this stinks! If I watch a comedy I want it to make me laugh not occasionally but more regularly after all you can occasionally in some dramas. I found nothing funny in this movie it ended up irritating me and I am not sure what Will Farrell's his accent was supposed to be, it was just bizarre. I have put in my heading it's 'the worst movie I have ever seen' I wanted to add 'and I have seen some rubbish'

Great movie,
Everyone stuck to the Essence of thier own craft, It's a good ol fashion comedy adventure.
and we all loved it,.It is perhaps understated, and over criticized,
Because 99.9% of media now is, over stimulating, edge of your seat crap.Period.

reviews.review_title: Rubbish but I think I actually enjoyed it.
reviews.content: The sequences spoofing the Guy Ritchie's Sherlock were always funny, secondary characters were played by surprisingly high profiles, and Billy Zane turned up for a cameo, which was hilariously pointless.

reviews.review_title: One of those terrible, but watchable, films
reviews.content: Right from the off this film makes its approach pretty clear. It does get tiresome after about 20 minutes but it remains watchable and the wacky, random, stereotypical and rather telegraphed jokes do grate, but you feel you need to keep watching. Not a Farrell classic, but not a disaster. Kids will love it as there's little subtlety in anything this film gives you but there are some rather adult moments. It's a farce, and should be judged on that basis.

In the great tradition of arrogant and stupid characters, Will Ferrell, but also his sidekick John C. Reilly (who shows once again what a great actor he is), brilliantly composes characters of great morons, condescending people. With always the same framework: Will Ferrel as an arrogant and contemptuous Sherlock Holmes, who will have to put water in his wine within the framework of the couple that he constitutes with Doctor Watson. This in the context of an investigation that will lead them to make fun of the Queen of England or to praise the jewel of technology that was the Titanic. Their friendship will be disturbed by female encounters: Lauren Kapkus in a high-flying moron act, Rebecca Hall as a doctor and Kelly Macdonald as the housekeeper of the couple Holmes & Sherlock, with the running gag of her lovers (Albert Einstein, Sigmund Freud, Charlie Chaplin or Mark Twain).The technical contributions are at the top (costumes, make-up, digital effects, sets) to support this story with its share of enormities, but which work, because all the trades invited to the constitution of the film know their jobs.
Both they are amazing.Perfect comedian duo .Funny like stepbrothers.Recommends to everybody's.Only sad people can give score 1.
This movie is just so stupid, I can even force myself to continue watching it in it's entirety! Just Say No!

Sometimes you watch a movie that is so stupid that you start to like it, you laugh, you are surprised by how stupid it can be, etc., so you know what I mean, it's like some good parody. Here that is not the case, the film is simply stupid, literally everything that is dragged through the film, from the acting which is below every profesional level, to visuals which is nothing special and all the way to the story itself which is catastrophically boring. The very fact that this film has a very pronounced woke character makes this whole situation not only stupid but also unwatchable in lot of moments. I'll be honest, maybe it's my fault, maybe I expected too much from the film, I thought it would be something more, something actually funny, because here the biggest emphasis is literally on comedy at least that's how it's presented to public, but unfortunately I couldn't find a single scene that would make me laugh, the jokes are somehow forced and clichéd to make matters worse and poorly presented. I don't know what to think about this failure, I don't understand, the film itself is a great potential that was missed and presented so badly that it was not watchable! I don't recommend it, I wouldn't even classify this as a below average time killer!

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as some reviews say
reviews.content: I watched this knowing the type of film it was. It had me and my wife chuckling from start to finish. It is a simple comedy with some funny moments that you can just watch without thinking too much. No over analysing needed.

If they would've named it "Not another Holmes movie", it wouldn't of been taken so seriously and maybe got better reviews. It's just a movie to poke fun of the Holmes movies and that era. Honestly if you were expecting more than Airplane style riffs, you were delusional
The producers should realize that not everyone who see their movies are liberal dems. But that aside, this movie is an immature comedy. But then again, Will Farrel is the star😐
It's totally ridiculous but what did everyone expect? These two have a history together of being ridiculous.
It's almost impressive that they managed to make such a awful movie with all these talented actors. Save your time, and poke your gums with a tooth pick, it'll be more enjoyable.

reviews.review_title: Make up your own mind (especially if you're a Sherlock Holmes fan)...
reviews.content: To think that I almost gave this movie a wide berth due to being a Sherlock Holmes aficionado and the unfavourable reviews. It was much better than anticipated. The sets, locations, wardrobe and nods to Holmesian London we're skilfully done and a pleasure to look at. It also has a good supporting cast. I had fully expected to cringe at the script and the humour but not so! It has been done in the style of classic silly British comedy with a few current references thrown in, incorporating convenient characters from the period along the way. I understand that comedy is personal but I don't understand the ridiculously poor reviews. I can only think that some of the subject matter is a little uncomfortable for some. But that's comedy. If you like anything Holmes related, comedy in a 'Carry On', 'Monty Python' or 'Young Frankenstein' vein, there's no reason why you shouldn't enjoy this.

reviews.review_title: Well this is the first 2/10 I've given
reviews.content:
I've had my reservation with these two actors over the years. Some movies of theirs I have enjoyed just for the pure silly side and humor that does work at times.
Not in this case. I've never been so disappointed in a film in my life. I turned it off after 15 minutes. Absolute crap.
Dreadful waste of time and money. Lame jokes. Ridiculous plot.

reviews.review_title: Why did i rate this? Go grinchin for this inchin
reviews.content:
I LOATHE will Ferrell people who are slow and lick windows are smarter. Strike that, he'll play that role too. I believe he loves to upset the nation and the movie producers. Well done my good man.
Do not see this movie, yes you may laugh once or twice.
Remember its ferrell and no iq is involved. Adam sandler same deal there.
Say no deal please.

reviews.review_title: White males are ruining everyone's lives.
reviews.content: Hi! I'm a white male and I ruin every other race and gender's lives. I think I chuckled at one or two parts in the movie but that's it. The rest of the jokes and gags are aimed at not-so-sublte political nuances. Trump is a tyrannical dictator, destroying our country through racism and selfishness. Women are oppressed by white males, all races are oppressed by white males. Must be so hard for them to succeed. So boring. I'll give the first jokes a pass because they were funny, clever, and fit into the reference of the movie. But then they kept bringing it back with references from earlier comments during events that didn't fit into the movie. When people said the movie was so bad, they walked out of it, I thought for sure it wouldn't be. But actually, it is THAT BAD. Don't waste an hour and a half of your life. Go outside and contemplate life instead.
I consider this movie as an insult for British literature, and particularly for sir Conan Doyle. Honestly, Ethan Coen disappointed me!

Being a fan of the detective, I was definitely up for this, pretty good cast, but how wrong was I, main characters were complete fools,portraying the legends as imbeciles, 20 minutes into the film,got very bored and moved, never been so disappointed in a film..

reviews.review_title: Couldnt even sit though it on a plane
reviews.content: I was on a plane from London to Sydney and I still couldn't watch more than 20 minutes of this film. The screen of the map of the world was giving me more enjoyment. I'm a big Sherlock, will, John & Adam fan. Missed the mark so far on this. And the British comedy royalty they had in the cast. Wow how was this so bad!

The costume design raises it to 2 stars. A waste of a good cast and public domain property. The only person who gets a pass is Lauren Lapkus because she does the best with the z rate script. Etan Cohen should be banished to directing public access TV commercials for the remainder of his career.

Considered leaving after 5 minutes. I only stayed for the whole movie in hopes of some funny moments. More shots at President Trump and gun control than there were laughs. Really disappointing considering the previous movies from Ferrell and Riley.

reviews.review_title: What else to expect from a parody
reviews.content: Movie is not that bad at all. Jokes seems a bit amateuristic since they're forcing british accent, but i had a few good laughs

I don't think most of the critics on this page actually saw the movie or at least not all of it. A lot of people are just jumping on the bandwagon. I've seen alot of Sherlock Holmes movies, funny ones, serious ones and this one is humorous and has its moments. Sure some of the ridiculous jokes are little overboard but it's still funny. People need to relax and enjoy for what it is. The scenery is good the acting is good, the costumes are passible. It's just an evening romp with good old Sherlock Holmes and Doctor Watson. The game is afoot.

Horrible. Stupid.
The worst I have ever seen. No comedy, just a display of human functions.

This film is absolutely horrible. My friends and I almost left but we thought it couldn't get worse (but it did) and then we would waste our money if we left (wasted our time instead). PLEASE DONT SEE THIS MOVIE!! The first half is the best part but the jokes are overdone till they are bad. The second half is the same but they have a musical section for some stupid reason. Plus they stop the movie for 2 full minutes of trump bashing

Somehow they managed to make a worse movie than the other two piles of poo they were in together.They're good actors. But when these two are are together in a movie, it's a nightmare.I wish it had an even lower rating.

Literally no one used a single brain cell in making is utter load of tarnation even for one second. And so it uses no brain cell to waste time upon when there is none to spare during stressful situations.It's not witty, not funny either, just brain fracking nonsense material.

Well this movie definitely wasn't Step Bros or Talladega Nights but it definitely wasn't as bad as say... Land Of The Lost, Daddy's Home 1&2, or Get Hard all of which have better ratings than this film. I think people just are disappointed it wasn't as good as the first 2 movies. Hey maybe they'll do a 4th an redeem themselves! Fingers crossed...

Nothing, and I mean absolutely nothing was funny about this.To make things worse, despite obviously having a big enough budget, there's rookie mistakes in here. The most painful of which being the obviously dubbed dialogue, that clearly doesn't match the mouth movements.There's really just no excuse for stuff like that.The only reason this isn't a 1/2 star, is because I feel like John C Reilly was at least trying his best. But apart from that, I have nothing positive to say about this movie.

Comedy is subjective
Any art is subjective
Subjectively, this was intolerably lazy and unimaginative. You don't have to be Sherlock Holmes to predict exactly what's going to happen while each gag is coming at you... Slowly... Painfully... And hitting you with all the impact of a pillow being thrown by a quadruple amputee.
In the end, I was left just shaking my head wondering what I was even doing there anymore.

reviews.review_title: Well, I thought it was excellent!
reviews.content: I was going round recommending this movie! This movie has many layers. The comedy is intelligent, the great performances match the style of the movie and there are so many hidden gems. Watson trying to match Holme's quick thinking was genius. I loved it. I guess you can't please a Trump supporter!

First off I'd like to say I'm upset at myself for choosing this movie over Mary Poppins, Aquaman, Wreck it Ralph and even Bumble Bee aka Transformers 20. This movie was terrible from start to finish in all aspects of the film.

This movie had to be the most awful thing I have ever seen... I've even watch Adam Sandler's movie Overboard! If you like this comedy duo do yourself a favor and don't watch this; if you do you will regret it immensely. Don't pay attention to the reviews saying it was good or anything like Talladega Nights, this movie was utter garbage and all of us who watched it were duped into wasting good money and our time sitting through this terrible, terrible movie!

reviews.review_title: Literally the worst movie I have ever seen in my life.
reviews.content: This movie was so bad we walked out of the theatre halfway through. Do not waste 2 hours of your life. Horrific film. Sad because these two are normally hilarious. I'd give it a zero if possible

reviews.review_title: opinion from a big Will Ferrell / John C Reilly fan
reviews.content:
Ok so, I read through tons of reviews on here, many of which are overwhelmingly terribad. We rolled the dice on it, and I went in with super low expectations expecting it to be god awful. it wasn't as bad as I thought, but the humor is a lot dryer compared to other WF/JCR movies (I love step Brothers, tallega nights, walk hard, old school, anchorman #1, Zoolander #1). The humor in this is more satire (they make fun of the RDJ Sherlock Holmes movie either planned out scientific fighting lol. There's a few anti-Trump references (who cares), it's more like Almost Heroes humor if both characters were Matthew Perry in it. (I LOVE Almost Heroes, rip Chris Farley).
Anyway, personally I would not pay for it if you know what I mean (we rented it on demand for $12, I told my husband if it sucked he had to give me $10). It didn't suck, it wasn't great, but it was decently silly and it has a great musical number in it. And lots of nonsensical anacronisms like music that didn't exist yet in the late 1800s, and the Titanic setting sail from England. Part of the charm.TLDR: if you like Will Ferrell and John C Reilly you'll like it enough :) I wouldn't pay over $3.99 for it though if you're renting it. get a firestick & teatv app using a VPN.

reviews.review_title: Total Waste Of Money and Time
reviews.content: I will never get that 90 minutes of my life back. Very disappointing.

Hands down the worst movie I have ever seen!,the opening seen with the young actors showed a little promise,but after the first 5 minutes it was all down hill! Poorly timed bathroom humor,it's s shame Ralph finnes tarnished his stellar movie career. Will Ferrell movies r either pretty good or really awful,I wouldn't say this is his Mona Lisa in the awful pile!

Movie trailers are typically a culmination of the best parts of a movie which is meant to pull you in and get you to watch it. Often times the handful of good scenes that you see in the trailer end up being most of the good scenes in the movie itself with, in the case of a bad movie, everything else in between sucking. That being said, the trailer for Holmes & Watson is so bad that you can only conclude that the movie itself is so awful that they couldn't even come up with a few good clips that make the movie look like it's worth watching. So my review has been based on the trailer alone which makes me smarter than everyone else who got suckered into watching this pile of cow dung.

I never actually had an idea it could be a comedy movie loljust the opening scene in which kid sherlock gets bullied therefore he cries while a lot of kids around him laughing at him and then as a coping mechanism he uncries his tears by making his tears gets back to his eyes and as a result he becomes emotionless genius detective scene deserves 8 stars alone which explains why sherlock is so autistic robot in BBC remake lol. It also have a lot of unforgotable funny scenes like a retard girl yells "what kind of dog it is" at a turtle and yeets the turtle, watson draws pistol to sherlock just because watson couldn't realize it was sherlock when sherlock disgused himself only with fake mustache even though he just put on a fake mustache in front of watson, sherlock pees by calculating the angle, the force, gravity, et cetera just like robert downey jr's sherlock was epicI really want to see a sequel but unfortunately society doesn't like complex non-primitive modern pure comedy therefore it will never happen lol. Well done people, go laugh at a man who slips on a banana peel. It never gets old, right? SMH.
This is one of the most ridiculous films I've had the misfortune of watching & I can never get that time back. Oh dear me just awful.... AN ABSOLUTE MUST NOT SEE FILM

reviews.review_title: There are few funny parts but.....
reviews.content: As per the usual Hollywood garbage the writer/director Etan Cohen (who was born in Israel) used the movie to shove his hatred and bigotry toward conservatives, President Trump, and generally the US as a whole down our throats.As others have said we don't go to movies to hear people bash our country and our President, we go to be entertained. And that is why this movie has failed in the box office and has so many bad reviews. This is why this movie will NOT get a sequel.Your "liberal political jokes" are not funny and therefore the movie just wasn't that funny. Not to mention these were all old jokes. These scenes have been done before. It was very unoriginal and frankly just quite sad.Etan Cohen needs to stick to what he does best. I'm not sure what that is but it IS NOT making movies.

In a nutshell, this movie was everything for everybody.
It also had just about every British actor who has ever worked in Hollywood in various cameo appearances. The core of the humor in the movie was making fun of idiosyncrasies of Brits and Yankees.The problem with the ratings for this movie lie in its inability to please either of its two principal demographics.
(1) The smart audience will understand the pop-culture reference that is being parodied or mocked. However, once you realize the reference, the joke itself isn't particularly funny. The biggest component of a joke is the surprise. If the audience instantaneously knows where the joke is headed then it isn't really funny. For example, starting to compare unelected British Monarch and then mentioning American democratically elected president in the first sentence, already telegraphs the upcoming Trump joke.
(2) The average audience will not understand any references and the movie doesn't really have any other types of jokes. So this type of audience is definitely going to dislike the movie.Watching the movie as like sitting at a standup comedy show that you have seen before, a few times. I can imagine there might be some who would be in hysterics watching this movie. But that is like a sweet spot of people just about smart enough to get the references but not experienced enough to have heard all the jokes before.
Sherlock Homes is a National Treasure and you are not fit to mock him!

reviews.review_title: A funny comedy - if not very misunderstood by those who have seen it
reviews.content: This comedy seems to have gone over very poorly with its audience. But reading a lot of the reviews on this site it just seems like people have misunderstood the comedy or gone into the film expecting something else.It pokes fun at both the Arthur Doyle books as well as very heavily the Sherlock movies with Robert Downey Jr.It does so in a very effortless manner and nothing feels forced, the comedy interactions all seem to come very natural and the jokes come and go very smoothly and nothing feels like it is shoved in your face.It is hard to say why so many people did not like the film but with comedy this is normal I guess as comedy is perhaps the one film genre that has no universal taste. When it comes to drama or action movies it is far easier to make a film that everyone will love.With comedy you will never find a movie that literally everyone loves, some people prefer old Pink Panther movies, some prefer new ones. Some people love the movie "Airplane!" others hate it.My style of comedy is Airplane as well as the new Pink Panther movies with Steve Martin. I also love Monty Python films.If you go into this film with an open mind you can come out enjoying it and will have probably had some good laughs. At least if the style of comedy is what you like.This is not the best comedy film I've seen either but that is why I have given it a 7 as it is worth watching once - having some good laughs and then probably never watching it again.

If you love movies that contain both Will Ferral and John C Reilly than this is a movie for you. They always compliment each other by bringing out their more childish and downright idiotic behavior! Not many actors can pull it off, and I believe they are the last remaining "white males" who have a free pass to act in such a way. Carefully trying to type the following sentence carefully on my cellphone when having a go on the potty; I in no means want to start a political debate. Keep in my mind this is my opinion and simply want to inform my fellow screen junkies why this movie is in fact good. Will Ferrale or "Sherlock Holmes" protrays this once known strong, handsome, smart character into a idiotic, feminine, and at times frail character. John C Reilley on the other hand stays a bit more true to the Character Watson, protraying the loyal, and slightly smarter doctor with the same hint of downright "idiotic" moments. So if you're hear to see another "Step-bros" or "Talladega Nights" movie well you're at the right place because that is exactly it... if you arn't such a fan, well my only opinion is try to watch it for what it is. A simple comedy of two guys acting like kids, kinda like the duo Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels in "Dumb and Dummer". Yeah exactly like dumb and dumber! It's silly and has primitive humour. With that in mind I can guarantee you a good laugh or two in the movies. PS if you can't stand a harmless joke, such as a sexiest remark once or twice in this movies well stay away. I'm sure the directors and actors would appreciate not having to deal with your uptight comments or "tweets". Im case you've forgotten this is a movie with Will Ferral and John C Reilley so what are you expecting anyways!

reviews.review_title: Dumb and Dumber? 3 Stooges? Laurel and Hardy?
reviews.content: Silly fun drawing sweetly on the continuing legacy of the Three Stooges, Laurel and Hardy, Abbot and Costello, etc. I remember the Dumb and Dumber series getting bad reviews too, but audiences always know better: these films make you laugh! Great sets with great actors. The flaw may have been in the editing-- it was a bit too quick, and left many great sight gags and comedy bits in the rear view mirror. I was grinning on the inside for most of the movie, which reminded me of how much I loved watching the Three Stooges--60 years ago! As for the Laurel and Hardy comparison--John C Reilly actually just got done playing Oliver Hardy in the wonderful biopic "Stan And Ollie"--yet another brilliant performance!
